info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 8:21PM EDT until July 11 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 817 PM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Local officials reported standing water in the Azalea Square Shopping Center, Trolley Road between Midland Parkway and Springview Lane as well as Jockey Court. In addition, Trinity Drive and Salem Drive in College Park Estates were impassible due to flooding. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Ladson, Ridgeville, Knightsville, Sangaree, Jedburg and College Park.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Berkeley, SC; Charleston, SC; Dorchester, SC
